trans-unit.id: h:!ACT!1~1#Section Heading
trans-unit.source: Acts 1:1-5 Introduction to the book.
trans-unit.target: Hechos 1:1-5 Introducción del libro.
trans-unit.note: !ACT!1~1#Section Heading

group.id: Q:ACT 1.1-5+What information did Luke, the writer of this book, give in this introduction?

trans-unit.id: q:!ACT!1~1#Question:What information did Luke, the writer of this book, give in this introduction?
trans-unit.source: What information did Luke, the writer of this book, give in this introduction?
trans-unit.target: ¿Qué información dio Lucas, el autor, en la introducción de este libro?
trans-unit.note: !ACT!1~1#Question:What information did Luke, the writer of this book, give in this introduction?

trans-unit.id: a:!ACT!1~1#Answer:What information did Luke, the writer of this book, give in this introduction?270938112
trans-unit.source: Luke reminded his readers that he was about to continue the true story about Jesus and his apostles that Luke had written in his first book. (1)
trans-unit.target: Lucas les hizo saber a sus lectores que continuaría la verdadera historia acerca de Jesús y sus apóstoles que les había relatado en su primer libro. (1)
trans-unit.note: !ACT!1~1#Answer:What information did Luke, the writer of this book, give in this introduction?

trans-unit.id: a:!ACT!1~1#Answer:What information did Luke, the writer of this book, give in this introduction?955149918
trans-unit.source: He also reminded his readers that Jesus had promised that his Father would send his followers the Holy Spirit. (5)
trans-unit.target: También recordó a sus lectores que Jesús había prometido que su Padre enviaría al Espíritu Santo a sus seguidores. (5)
trans-unit.note: !ACT!1~1#Answer:What information did Luke, the writer of this book, give in this introduction?

group.id: Q:ACT 13.8+What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?

trans-unit.id: q:!ACT!13~8#Question:What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?
trans-unit.source: What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?
trans-unit.target: ¿Con qué otro nombre fue conocido Bar-Jesús?
trans-unit.note: !ACT!13~8#Question:What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?

trans-unit.id: l:!ACT!13~8#Alternate:What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?1875268277
trans-unit.source: What other name did people call Bar-Jesus?
trans-unit.target: ¿Qué otro nombre usaba la gente para Bar-Jesús?
trans-unit.note: !ACT!13~8#Alternate:What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?

trans-unit.id: a:!ACT!13~8#Answer:What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?1864367862
trans-unit.source: [People] also called Bar-Jesus by the name Elymas. [In the Greek language] Elymas means "the sorcerer." (8)
trans-unit.target: La gente también le llamaban a Bar-Jesús por su [otro] nombre [griego] Elimas, que significa "el hechicero". (8)
trans-unit.note: !ACT!13~8#Answer:What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?

trans-unit.id: n:!ACT!13~8#Note:What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?-1087263428
trans-unit.source: (Note: Several people who Luke has mentioned in Acts had two names. For example, Tabitha, or Dorcas (9:36), Bar-Jesus, or Elymas (13:6, 8), and Saul, or Paul (13:9). (See the NIV footnote on 9:36.) The reason that these people had two names was that one was the person's name in Hebrew, or Aramaic, and the other was his or her name in Greek.)
trans-unit.target: (Nota: Varias personas que Lucas mencionó en Hechos tenían dos nombres. Por ejemplo, Tabitá, o Dorcas (9:36), Bar-Jesús, o Elimas (13: 6, 8), y Saulo, o Pablo (13: 9). (Vea la nota al pie de la NVI en 9:36). La razón por la cual estas personas tenían dos nombres era que uno era el nombre de la persona en hebreo o arameo, y el otro era su nombre en griego.)
trans-unit.note: !ACT!13~8#Note:What other name did [people] call Bar-Jesus?

group.id: Q:LUK 5.36+If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.

trans-unit.id: q:!LUK!5~36#Question:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.
trans-unit.source: If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.
trans-unit.target: Si los hablantes de su idioma usan lenguaje simbólico/parábolas, cuénteme una de esas historias y luego cuénteme su significado.
trans-unit.note: !LUK!5~36#Question:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.

trans-unit.id: l:!LUK!5~36#Alternate:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.2019661025
trans-unit.source: If the people who speak your language use picture language, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.

trans-unit.note: !LUK!5~36#Alternate:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.

trans-unit.id: l:!LUK!5~36#Alternate:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.966642417
trans-unit.source: If the people who speak your language use parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.
trans-unit.target: Si los hablantes de su idioma usan parábolas, cuénteme una de esas historias y luego cuénteme su significado.
trans-unit.note: !LUK!5~36#Alternate:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.

trans-unit.id: a:!LUK!5~36#Answer:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.-180753404
trans-unit.source: Key Term Check: A parable shows its meaning indirectly by using picture language to make a comparison. The parts of the comparison are generally not explained. The listeners themselves must think much about the meaning hidden in each part of the picture language. Jesus taught spiritual truths in this story form.
trans-unit.target: Verificación de término clave: una parábola muestra su significado indirectamente utilizando lenguaje simbólico para hacer una comparación. Las partes de la comparación generalmente no se explican. Los oyentes mismos deben pensar profundamente sobre el significado oculto en cada símbolo. Jesús enseñó verdades espirituales utilizando esta estilo de historia.
trans-unit.note: !LUK!5~36#Answer:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.

trans-unit.id: n:!LUK!5~36#Note:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.903541393
trans-unit.source: See "parable" in KBT.
trans-unit.target: Véase "parábola" en TBC.
trans-unit.note: !LUK!5~36#Note:If the people who speak your language use picture language/parables, tell me one of those stories and then tell me its meaning.
